title: Quadrant-backed APM swoops on ASX-listed Konekt: sources
text:
Konekt is the country's largest private sector provider of organisational health and risk management solutions. It was founded in 1985 and has a market capitalisation on the ASX of $30.68 million.

Konekt has grown rapidly in recent years to have a presence across regional Australia and offices in every capital city.

It most recently acquired the disability employment services business of Artius, based in Ipswich, Queensland.

Quadrant invested in Western Australia-based APM, then known as Advanced Personnel Management in May 2017. At the time, it was the largest provider of disability employment services contracts in the country.

In November last year APM snapped up Ingeus, a business founded by Thérèse Rein, wife of former prime minister Kevin Rudd.
description: Quadrant Private Equity's human services business APM is set to snap up a listed rival.
